meanings.definition: Microcopies: a microfilm or microfiche copy of a document.
meanings.sent1: The library keeps important documents as microcopies for safekeeping.
meanings.sent2: I need to find the microcopies of the old newspapers for my research project.
meanings.sent3: The detective found a tiny spy who was making microcopies of secret files.
meanings.sent4: Her memory was like a collection of microcopies, storing every detail perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The scientist used a magnifying glass to study the microcopies of the ancient manuscript.

meanings.definition: Microcopies: to make a microfilm or microfiche copy of a document.
meanings.sent1: She will microcopy the important papers before sending them out.
meanings.sent2: Please remember to microcopy the contract before signing it.
meanings.sent3: The students decided to microcopy their notes to share with each other.
meanings.sent4: His mind seemed to microcopy every detail of the crime scene for later analysis.
meanings.sent5: The artist wanted to microcopy the intricate design onto a smaller canvas.
